TEXT: The applicant is a national of GPE , born in DATE . Before the ORG he is represented by ORG , a lawyer practising in GPE , GPE .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

On DATE the applicant and his wife , PERSON , arrived in GPE with their son , born in DATE . They applied for asylum . In DATE their daughter was born . On DATE ORG ( ORG invandrarverk ) rejected the application . The decision was upheld by ORG ( Utlänningsnämnden ) on DATE . However , due to difficulties in expelling people to GPE , the family remained in GPE .

By a judgment of DATE ORG ( tingsrätten ) of GPE sentenced the applicant to DATE in prison for , inter alia , threatening behaviour ( olaga hot ) and violation of a visiting ban ( överträdelse av besöksförbud ) . The court ordered his expulsion from GPE and prohibited him from returning before DATE . The court noted that , following several reports by GPE that she had been threatened by the applicant , the public prosecutor , by a decision of DATE , had banned the applicant from visiting GPE for a period of DATE . She had also been given a security alarm by the police . The court found that the applicant , on CARDINAL and DATE , had violated the visiting ban and had threatened to “ cut [ ORG ’s ] throat ” .

ORG took into account that , on CARDINAL occasions DATE , the applicant had been fined for various crimes , including threatening behaviour in DATE and drunken driving ( rattfylleri ) and shoplifting ( snatteri ) in DATE . In fixing his sentence at CARDINAL months’ imprisonment , the court also had regard to the detriment suffered by the applicant as a result of his expulsion .
The applicant and PERSON were divorced on DATE . By an interim decision , PERSON was awarded custody of the children .
On DATE ORG ( hovrätten ) for Southern Norrland upheld ORG judgment of DATE .
On DATE ORG convicted the applicant of theft ( stöld ) and ordered that the previously imposed sanction should also comprise this crime .
On DATE ORG ( Högsta domstolen ) refused the applicant leave to appeal against ORG judgment of DATE .

On DATE the applicant was sentenced by ORG to DATE imprisonment for driving without a driver ’s licence ( olovlig körning ) and for a new violation of the visiting ban . Finally , on CARDINAL DATE , ORG convicted the applicant of gross drunken driving ( grovt rattfylleri ) and for driving without a driver ’s licence , and sentenced him once again to DATE imprisonment .

On DATE ORG granted GPE and the children residence permits in GPE . ORG took into account that they had remained in GPE due to the ban on expelling people to GPE . As a result , they had lived in GPE for DATE and the children had developed connections to GPE . Thus , there were humanitarian reasons not to expel them from GPE .
On DATE ORG , referring to the expulsion order against the applicant , rejected his application for a residence permit .
Later the applicant requested the Government to annul the expulsion order . By decision of CARDINAL DATE the ORG rejected the request .
On DATE ORG of GPE awarded GPE permanent custody of the children and granted the applicant a right of access to them .
On DATE ORG rejected a request from the applicant for a reopening of the criminal proceedings against him .
On DATE the ORG rejected a new request from the applicant for annulment of the expulsion order .
